result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David D. Olson

records.addlTxt:

State requests warrant.
Warrant ordered but stayed until 11/7/22 at 12:00 PM.

records.addlTxt:
11:00am Cases called: 22CF1083 & 22CF1084.Defendant David Olson appears in custody via video conference from the Eau Claire County Jail with Attorney Ryan Kohler. Attorney Trenton Piltz appeared for in person for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives reading of both complaints. Contact information updated on the record. Time limits for 22CF1084 waived and bond set.

Case recalled at 11:52am to allow time for Attorney Kohler to speak with Defendant regarding extradition options.
Extradition in 22CF1083 waived and the document signed.

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/12/22 at 3:15pm
Hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
